galaxies.name: Andromeda Galaxy
galaxies.description: The nearest spiral galaxy to the Milky Way and the largest galaxy in the Local Group.

galaxies.name: Milky Way
galaxies.description: The galaxy that contains our Solar System, characterized by its milky appearance.

galaxies.name: Whirlpool Galaxy
galaxies.description: A classic spiral galaxy known for its distinctive whirlpool-like appearance.

galaxies.name: Sombrero Galaxy
galaxies.description: Named for its resemblance to a sombrero hat, this galaxy is famous for its bright nucleus and large central bulge.

galaxies.name: Triangulum Galaxy
galaxies.description: A member of the Local Group, it is one of the most distant permanent objects that can be viewed with the naked eye.

galaxies.name: Pinwheel Galaxy
galaxies.description: A face-on spiral galaxy distinguished by its bright core and expansive arms.

galaxies.name: Black Eye Galaxy
galaxies.description: Also known as the Evil Eye Galaxy, it is notable for the dark band of absorbing dust in front of its bright nucleus.

galaxies.name: Cigar Galaxy
galaxies.description: This starburst galaxy is famous for its size and brightness, making it a popular target for amateur astronomers.

galaxies.name: Bode's Galaxy
galaxies.description: A grand design spiral galaxy that, along with the Cigar Galaxy, forms a popular pair for observers.

galaxies.name: Fireworks Galaxy
galaxies.description: Known for its supernova explosions and intense star formation, resembling a fireworks display.

galaxies.name: Sunflower Galaxy
galaxies.description: Its appearance is reminiscent of the sunflower plant, with a short bulge and long, thin arms.

galaxies.name: Silver Dollar Galaxy
galaxies.description: So named for its bright appearance and round shape, resembling a silver dollar.

galaxies.name: Tadpole Galaxy
galaxies.description: Characterized by its elongated tail caused by a merger with a smaller galaxy, resembling a tadpole.

galaxies.name: Comet Galaxy
galaxies.description: This galaxy has a distinctive appearance caused by intense star formation that resembles a comet.

galaxies.name: Cartwheel Galaxy
galaxies.description: A ring galaxy that resembles the wheel of a cart, caused by a collision with another galaxy.

galaxies.name: Sculptor Galaxy
galaxies.description: A barred spiral galaxy that is one of the brightest galaxies in the sky, located in the Sculptor constellation.

galaxies.name: Needle Galaxy
galaxies.description: A narrow, edge-on spiral galaxy, giving it the appearance of a needle.

galaxies.name: Butterfly Galaxies
galaxies.description: A pair of interacting galaxies with a striking resemblance to the wings of a butterfly.

galaxies.name: Siamese Twins Galaxies
galaxies.description: Two spiral galaxies in the process of colliding and merging, creating a stunning visual.

galaxies.name: Hoag's Object
galaxies.description: A peculiar ring galaxy with a nearly perfect circular appearance, surrounded by a ring of stars.

galaxies.name: Mouse Galaxies
galaxies.description: Two galaxies with long tails caused by their mutual gravitational interactions, resembling mice.
